=Trying out the BCCAPI with !SimpleClient=

!SimpleClient is a text-based bitcoin client implemented on top of the BCCAPI. It is written in Java and open source. You find !SimpleClient as an example within the BCCAPI sources (com.bccapi.example.!SimpleClient.java).

== Building Everything Yourself ==
Software needed: [http://subversion.apache.org Subversion],  [http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html JDK], [http://ant.apache.org/bindownload.cgi Ant].
 # Get the code: `svn checkout http://bccapi.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ bccapi`
 # Compile the jar: `cd bccapi && ant clean bccapi-jar`
 # Start the SimpleClient:
  # For the bitcoin test network: `java -jar build/jar/bccapi.jar testnet`
  # For the bitcoin production network: `java -jar build/jar/bccapi.jar prodnet`
 # Follow the instructions

== Using a Pre-Built JAR ==
Software needed: [http://www.java.com/en/download/ JRE] or [http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html JDK] 
 # Download [http://code.google.com/p/bccapi/downloads/list bccapi.jar]
 # Start the SimpleClient:
  # For the bitcoin test network: `java -jar bccapi.jar testnet`
  # For the bitcoin production network: `java -jar bccapi.jar prodnet`
 # Follow the instructions
